gus_groups¶

models¶

class gus2.gus_groups.models.GroupManager[source]¶
create_group(groupname, description='', image='')[source]¶

this will create a new group and insert it into the table

@type groupname:string @param groupname: the name of the new group to create @type description:string @param description: the description of the group @type image:string @param image: the image to associate with the group @rtype:gus_roles.models.gus_group @return: the newly created group

Example >>>gus_roles.objects.create_role(<gus_group object>,’group_name’) (<gus_role object>)
has_member(gusUser)[source]¶

this shall return a list of all groups that have the specified user as a member

@type gusUser: gus_users.models.gus_user @param gusUser: the user to locate groups for

class gus2.gus_groups.models.gus_group(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

class gus_group is our model of a group it shall encompass both the data and discreet functionality of groupss

test_forms¶

tests¶

This file demonstrates two different styles of tests (one doctest and one unittest). These will both pass when you run “manage.py test”.

This tests general group functionality

Replace these with more appropriate tests for your application.

class gus2.gus_groups.tests.SimpleTest(methodName='runTest')[source]¶
test_advanced_groupCreate()¶

tests that trying to create a group with the same name as an existing one will fail tests functionality of L{gus_group.create_group<gus2.gus_groups.models.GroupManager.create_group>}

test_basic_groupCreateDelete()¶

tests that a group can be created successfully uses Django’s built in delete() functionality for models tests functionality of L{gus_group.create_group<gus2.gus_groups.models.GroupManager.create_group>}

test_edit_group()¶

tests trying to edit the description of a group tests functionality of L{gus_group.create_group<gus2.gus_groups.models.GroupManager.create_group>}

utils¶

gus2.gus_groups.utils.createNewGroup(owner, group_name='', group_desc='', group_image='')[source]¶

creates a new group and the default roles associated with it @param owner: the user who is the owner of this group @param group_name: the name for this group @param group_desc: the description for this group @param group_image: the image for this group @return: the new group

gus2.gus_groups.utils.getGroupRoles(group)[source]¶

return all the roles (with users) for a given group @param group: the group to return the roles of @return: a query set of roles that the group is associated with

gus2.gus_groups.utils.getGroupsWithUser(user)[source]¶

return a list of groups with user as a member

@type user: gus_users.models.gus_user @param user: the user to fetch the groups for @rtype: queryset @return: list of groups that have this user as a member

gus2.gus_groups.utils.makeSlug(slug)[source]¶

replaces spaces with underscores and makes the string lowercase

@type slug:string @param slug:the normal string with mixed upper/lower case and spaces @rtype: string @return: the string with all lowercase and spaces replaced with underscores

gus2.gus_groups.utils.setDiff(src_set, set2)[source]¶

helper function, yeilds the difference of two sets src_set should be the larger of the two @param src_set: the first set (should be the larger of the two) @param set2: the second set (should be the smaller of the two) @return: a set that contains elements in src_set that are not in set2
